conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system consisting of the child, pillow, and ball.
The tension T in the rope acts along the rope.
The gravitational force m1 g acts on the pillow vertically downward.
The gravitational force m2 g acts on the child vertically downward.
The normal force N acts perpendicular to the inclined plane on the ball.
The tension T has two components: T cos β vertically upward and T sin β horizontally towards the inclined plane.
The net force along the inclined plane is zero since the ball slides without friction.
The component of tension along the inclined plane T sin β balances the component of gravitational force along the inclined plane m1 g sin α.
The pillow experiences a downward gravitational force m1 g.
The tension T provides an upward force T cos β.
The force exerted by the pillow on the child is the net force acting on the pillow.
From the equilibrium condition along the inclined plane, T sin β = m1 g sin α.
Solve for T: T = (m1 g sin α) / sin β.
The force exerted by the pillow on the child is F_pillow = m1 g - T cos β.
Substitute T to get F_pillow = m1 g - ((m1 g sin α) / sin β) cos β.
The ratio R is given by R = T / F_pillow.
Substitute the expressions for T and F_pillow to get R = (sin α) / (sin β - sin α cos β).
The ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is R = (sin α) / (sin β - sin α cos β).
